title: Notes by the Way; or, what I saw in my rambles
author: Higginson, H. Talbot.
snippet: When the bugle is soundedhere, the notes reverberate from hill and dell, far and near, around andon every side, some soft, some loud, some in rapid succession, otherspausing—the whole producing an effect which words cannot describe. Continuing our voyage, we come to a lovely scene called the Meetingof the Waters. Here the Long Range is divided into two channels byDivis Island.
